title: Jamie Lomas returns to Hollyoaks for the first time since his brawl with Asan NJie brawl
text:
He was involved in a violent brawl with former Emmerdale star Asan NJie in September.

And Jamie Lomas was pictured back on the set of Hollyoaks in Liverpool on Thursday as he reprised his role as Warren Fox, for the first time since the shocking fight at the TV Choice Awards.

The 44-year-old actor's return to the Channel 4 soap comes as Asan NJie's final scenes on Emmerdale aired, following his sacking by soap bosses.

Guess who's back? Jamie Lomas was pictured back on the set of Hollyoaks in Liverpool on Thursday as he reprised his role as Warren Fox

Getting back into character as the menacing bad boy, Jamie donned a black bomber jacket, blue jeans and black boots as she strutted around on the Lime Pictures set.

And the star looked as though he was certainly hoping to return with a bang as he was seen studying his lines in between takes.

His character was last seen on the show in July, driving off with the twins he shares with ex Sienna Blake, after leaving them in the care of a nanny.

After spotting them by chance at a hotel, Sienna was convinced the twins were hers and concocted an elaborate plan to steal them back, after being kept apart from them for so long.

Comeback: Jamie returned to the set of the Channel 4 soap for the first time since his TV Choice Awards brawl with former Emmerdale star Asan NJie

But her friends convinced her that she was mistaken and convinced her to abandon her plan, leaving Sienna confused and doubting whether they were really her children at all.

However, her mother's instincts proved to be true as Warren later made a shock, brief reappearance before disappearing again with the babies.

Hollyoaks later confirmed that Jamie was once again return for a longer stint in the New Year, where he'll no doubt come face-to-face with Sienna once more in the battle for their children.

He'll appear in the all new Hollyoaks Later episode, which will make it's much-anticipated return in January, airing at 10pm on E4.

Back in action: Getting back into character as the menacing bad boy, Jamie donned a black bomber jacket, blue jeans and black boots as she strutted around on the Lime Pictures set

Speaking of the spin-off episode centred around Warren and Sienna, the soap's boss Brian Kirkwood said: 'We're delighted that the channel wants to dip it's toe back into Hollyoaks Later and it will see the climax of one of our biggest, most explosive long term stories. Our biggest characters are right in the middle of what happens in that hour.'

Jamie's return to Hollyoaks comes following his shock brawl with Emmerdale's Asan NJie at the 2019 TV Choice Awards.

The actor was seen throwing a punch at Jamie during an explosive fight in front of shocked onlookers, shouting: 'I'm going to f*****g kill you'.

Rehearsal: Jamie's return to the Channel 4 soap comes as Asan NJie's final scenes on Emmerdale aired, following his sacking by soap bosses

Asan, who has been involved in a knife attack Emmerdale plot, could be heard shouting in a video obtained by the Mirror: 'Do you think you are a f*****g big man? I'm going to f*****g kill you. I'm going to f*****g knife you,' before attempting to take a swipe at Jamie.

After the Asan threw the punch, I'm A Celebrity's Malique Thompson-Dwyer ran into the room to intervene and bundle Jamie out.

According to reports, the pair had to be pulled apart by security twice at the Hilton Park Lane hotel in Mayfair, London, with Asan eventually being escorted off the premises by staff at around 11pm.

Emmerdale announced that Asan had been sacked from the soap two days after footage surfaced of the brawl.

Drama: Asan was sacked by ITV from his role as Ellis Chapman on Emmerdale after threatening to 'knife' Hollyoaks actor Jamie at the TV Choice Awards last month

Upsetting: The actor was seen throwing a punch at Jamie (pictured) during an explosive fight in front of shocked onlookers, and he was sacked two days after the footage emerged

An ITV spokesperson told MailOnline: 'Emmerdale suspended Asan N'Jie yesterday pending further investigation into an incident at a central London hotel on Monday night.

'ITV executives have met with him this morning and as a consequence Asan's contract has been terminated with immediate effect.'

In a further statement given to MailOnline, Asan said: 'My behaviour at the TV Choice Awards was completely unacceptable and very much out of character.

'I sincerely apologise to everybody who has been affected especially Jamie Lomas, the whole Emmerdale team, our audience, ITV, my family, and the organisers of the TV Choice Awards. I am devastated, +accept full responsibility for my actions and I am determined to learn from this.'

Bad news: The exit of Emmerdale character Ellis Chapman has been revealed after actor Asan was sacked following a brawl with Hollyoaks star Jamie

Asan's brawl with Jamie was reportedly sparked by a financial dispute with one of his co-stars.

His final scenes as Ellis Chapman aired on Thursday, with his onscreen brother Billy announcing that Ellis had moved to live with his mother Jessie in Dubai, after being 'worked into the ground' by his father Al.

Meanwhile, in addition to Hollyoaks, Jamie also starred as the lead role in a new film Lead Belly, which aimed to raise awareness of military veterans suffering with mental health issues and homelessness.

Jamie plays ex-soldier Mark in the film, which he produced, and also stars alongside former Emmerdale actress Sammy Winward.
description: Jamie Lomas, 44, was pictured back on the set of Hollyoaks in Liverpool on Thursday as he reprised his role as Warren Fox for the first time since his brawl with ex Emmerdale star Asan NJie.
